Detailed Description

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
class stMAMViewExtractor< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >

This class template implements the MAM View extractor.

Author
Fabio Jun Takada Chino (chino.nosp@m.@icm.nosp@m.c.usp.nosp@m..br)
Todo:

Documentation missing.

Pivot storage support not implemented.

Definition at line 255 of file stMAMView.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
stMAMViewExtractor< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::stMAMViewExtractor ( EvaluatorType *  eval)
inline

Creates a new instance of this extractor. This instance will not be ready to use until the first call of Init().

Parameters
evalAn instance of the metric evaluator. This instance will never be disposed.

Member Function Documentation

template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
void stMAMViewExtractor< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::BeginAnimation ( const char *  title = NULL,
const char *  comment = NULL 
)

Declares the beginning of an animation. It must be called before any other declaration methods. Both title and comment parameter are optional.

Parameters
titleThe title of this animation.
commentA little comment text about the animation.
Bug:
Both fields do not support > and < characters.
template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
void stMAMViewExtractor< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::BeginFrame ( const char *  comment)

Declares the beginning of a frame.

Parameters
commentA little comment text about the frame.
Warning
This command is not allowed outside an animation.
template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
void stMAMViewExtractor< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::EnableNode ( stPageID  nodeID)

Changes the state of a node to enabled. The node must exists or the command will not produce any result.

Parameters
nodeIDThe ID of the node.
Warning
This command is not allowed outside a frame.
template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
void stMAMViewExtractor< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::EndAnimation ( )

Declares the end of the animation. It must be the last command of an animation.

template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
void stMAMViewExtractor< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::EndFrame ( )

Declares the end of a frame.

Warning
This command is not allowed outside an animation.

Definition at line 490 of file stMAMView.h.

template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
void stMAMViewExtractor< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::Init ( stMAMViewObjectSample< ObjectType > *  sample)

Initializes the mapper to be used by this extractor. It requires a set of objects (at least 50) which must be representative to the whole set of objects.

Parameters
sampleA sample of objects.

template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
void stMAMViewExtractor< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::SetNode ( stPageID  nodeID,
ObjectType **  reps,
stDistance *  radii,
int  n,
stPageID  parent,
int  type,
bool  active = false 
)

Declares a node with multiple representative objects. If the node already exists, it will be overwritten.

Parameters
nodeIDThe ID of the node. It must be unique for each node.
repsThe set of representative objects.
radiiThe set of radius for each representative.
nThe number of representative.
parentThe parent node.
typeThe type ID.
activeThe declaration state.
Warning
This command is not allowed outside a frame.

Referenced by stMAMViewExtractor< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::SetNode().

template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
void stMAMViewExtractor< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::SetObject ( ObjectType *  obj,
stPageID  parent,
bool  active = false 
)

Declares an object. The object is identified by its coordinates and its parent. The existing object will be overwritten.

Parameters
objThe object.
parentIts parent.
activeThe current state.
Warning
This command is not allowed outside a frame.
Bug:
Two objects with the same pair coordinates/parent will be considered the same. A solution to this is on he way.
template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
void stMAMViewExtractor< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::SetOutputDir ( const char *  outputDir)

Set the output directory. All XML files will be stored in this directory.

Parameters
outputDirThe output directory. If none, it will assume the current directory as the output directory.

Referenced by stSlimTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::MAMViewSetOutputDir().

template<class ObjectType , class EvaluatorType >
void stMAMViewExtractor< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::SetQueryInfo ( int  k,
stDistance  radius 
)
inline

Sets the default values to k and radius of a query. Useful when both values do not change during an animation. This method is used in combination with SetResult(ObjectType,stResult<ObjectType>) method.

Parameters
kDesired k or 0 if it is not important.
radiusDesired radius or 0 if it is not important.
